channel.title: Router/Modem Problem
channel.description: Hey I'm having a problem with my router, just wondering if you could help... When I plug my computer into the modem through my router I can connect to the internet, but when I connect directly to the modem I can't get a connection. It says "limited or no connectivity" but in the connection status area, I'm getting a normal high speed connection. My computer automatically acquires an IP (dynamic) and the modem is a cable modem. Any ideas as to what might be causing this? Thank you. :)[br][size=1]Posted at: December 05, 2006, 10:40:05 PM[/size][hr]Admin or mods please delete I've figured it out. ;D

item.title: Router/Modem Problem
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

Yea, it was a little more complicated than that, it involved me setting up my own DNS server, but I’ve figured it out now.
But thanks anyway…

Read full topic

item.title: Router/Modem Problem
item.dc:creator: @Thabest Thabest
item.description:
@Thabest wrote:

Right click the little computer icon and click repair, if that doesn’t work try restarting your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Router/Modem Problem
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

Hey I’m having a problem with my router, just wondering if you could help…
When I plug my computer into the modem through my router I can connect to the internet, but when I connect directly to the modem I can’t get a connection.
It says “limited or no connectivity” but in the connection status area, I’m getting a normal high speed connection. My computer automatically acquires an IP (dynamic) and the modem is a cable modem.
Any ideas as to what might be causing this?
Thank you. :)[br][size=1]Posted at: December 05, 2006, 10:40:05 PM[/size][hr]Admin or mods please delete I’ve figured it out. ;D

Read full topic
